title: How to Tie a Sikh Turban

steps.title: Pull up your hair.
steps.content: Pull up your hair. Sikhs often pile their hair on top of their head in a type of bun to keep it under the fabric. A patka is considered a kid's turban or one that you can wear to play active sports in. Often, Sikhs tie one on under a regular turban as a way to hold it in place, which is why it's first in this article. It is a smaller piece of cloth than a full turban.

steps.title: Pull your hair to the top of your head as if you were making a ponytail there.
steps.content: Pull your hair to the top of your head as if you were making a ponytail there. Begin twisting the hair altogether, making a thick rope of your hair. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Begin twisting the rope of hair around itself.
steps.content: Begin twisting the rope of hair around itself. Make a knot on the top of your head near the front. Keep wrapping it around itself. If it's long enough, you can pull part of it through itself to form a sort of slip knot. If not, wrap the end around the knot. Secure with an elastic holder if it doesn't want to stay. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tie on a patka.
steps.content: Tie on a patka. Some Sikhs wear a patka under their turbans. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Start with a patka cloth.
steps.content: Start with a patka cloth. Place it over your forehead, holding a corner in each hand. Tie the corners from the front at the back of your head. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the corner strings up from the back.
steps.content: Pull the corner strings up from the back. Cross one over and around the knot on your head, holding it under your chin for the moment. Cross the other one around the other way. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap the ends around the front of the knot.
steps.content: Wrap the ends around the front of the knot. Tie them at the back of your hair knot. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Hold one corner of your turban in your mouth.
steps.content: Hold one corner of your turban in your mouth. Holding one end in your mouth allows you to have both hands free while you wrap the turban.

steps.title: Wrap the turban around the back of your head and then up around your hair knot.
steps.content: Wrap the turban around the back of your head and then up around your hair knot. Pull it back around to the front, going around the knot. Let it go lower around the front of your head on one side.

steps.title: Loop it around your head again.
steps.content: Loop it around your head again. This time, go higher on the other side of your head as you loop around. Pull it down lower on the other side. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Keep wrapping it around your head.
steps.content: Keep wrapping it around your head. Layer it as you go. In fact, you can create a stair-step effect on the front of your head as you wrap it around. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tuck in the end.
steps.content: Tuck in the end. When you come to the end of your turban cloth, tuck it into the top folds of the turban. Be sure to pull it tight so it stays in place. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tuck the end from your mouth in.
steps.content: Tuck the end from your mouth in. Pull the end around the back, and tuck it under the back folds of the fabric. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Hold one end of the turban in your mouth.
steps.content: Hold one end of the turban in your mouth. You will be able to wrap with both hands if you hold one end in your mouth. Hold it in the left side of your mouth.

steps.title: Wrap the turban around the back of your head.
steps.content: Wrap the turban around the back of your head. Start on the left side and come up high on the right side. Come around the top of the knot.

steps.title: Wrap it low on the left side.
steps.content: Wrap it low on the left side. As you come around the left side, wrap the turban low, covering the top part of your ear.

steps.title: Keep wrapping it.
steps.content: Keep wrapping it. On the right side, go lower on each wrap. On the left side, go higher on each wrap.

steps.title: Wrap the end around the peak.
steps.content: Wrap the end around the peak. As you wrap, a peak will begin to form on the front of your head. Wrap the end around the peak. It will look like the center of a bow, as the end will pinch the peak. Each side comes out wider than the middle. This type of knot was used by kings.

steps.title: Tuck in the other end.
steps.content: Tuck in the other end. Pull the other end around the back. Pull it up over the crown of the head, covering the exposed part of the patka. Tuck it under the top folds.

steps.title: Make adjustments.
steps.content: Make adjustments. Stretch out the turban so it fits well over all parts of your head.
